title: Establishes a residential-commercial exemption program in certain counties
summary: Establishes a residential-commercial real property tax exemption program in certain counties.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          863

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  YOUNG  -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Local Government

       AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to establishing a
         residential-commercial exemption  program  in  certain  counties;  and
         providing for the repeal of such provisions upon the expiration there-
         of

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The real property tax  law  is  amended  by  adding  a  new
    2  section 485-n to read as follows:
    3    S 485-N.  RESIDENTIAL-COMMERCIAL EXEMPTION PROGRAM. 1. DEFINITIONS. AS
    4  USED IN THIS SECTION, THE FOLLOWING TERMS SHALL HAVE THE FOLLOWING MEAN-
    5  INGS:
    6    (A)  "APPLICANT" MEANS ANY PERSON OBLIGATED TO PAY REAL PROPERTY TAXES
    7  ON REAL PROPERTY FOR WHICH AN EXEMPTION FROM TAXES UNDER THIS SECTION IS
    8  SOUGHT.
    9    (B) "BENEFIT AREA" MEANS THE AREA WITHIN A MUNICIPALITY, DESIGNATED BY
   10  LOCAL LAW, TO WHICH AN EXEMPTION, ESTABLISHED PURSUANT TO THIS  SECTION,
   11  APPLIES.
   12    (C)  "COMMERCIAL CONSTRUCTION WORK" MEANS THE MODERNIZATION, REHABILI-
   13  TATION, EXPANSION OR OTHER IMPROVEMENT OF COMMERCIAL USE PROPERTY OR THE
   14  PORTION OF MIXED-USE PROPERTY TO BE USED FOR COMMERCIAL PURPOSES.
   15    (D) "COMMERCIAL PURPOSE OR USE" MEANS THE BUYING, SELLING OR OTHERWISE
   16  PROVIDING OF GOODS OR  SERVICES,  INCLUDING  HOTEL  SERVICES,  OR  OTHER
   17  LAWFUL  BUSINESS OR COMMERCIAL ACTIVITIES PERMITTED UPON MIXED-USE PROP-
   18  ERTY.
   19    (E) "COMMERCIAL USE PROPERTY" MEANS REAL PROPERTY ON WHICH WILL EXIST,
   20  AFTER COMPLETION OF COMMERCIAL CONSTRUCTION WORK, A  BUILDING  USED  FOR
   21  COMMERCIAL PURPOSES OR USE.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02688-01-1

       S. 863                              2

    1    (F)  "MIXED-USE  PROPERTY"  MEANS  REAL  PROPERTY ON WHICH WILL EXIST,
    2  AFTER COMPLETION OF RESIDENTIAL CONSTRUCTION WORK OR  A  COMBINATION  OF
    3  RESIDENTIAL CONSTRUCTION WORK AND COMMERCIAL CONSTRUCTION WORK, A BUILD-
    4  ING OR STRUCTURE USED FOR BOTH RESIDENTIAL AND COMMERCIAL PURPOSES.
    5    (G) "MUNICIPALITY" MEANS ANY TOWN, CITY, VILLAGE OR OTHER TAXING ENTI-
    6  TY  LOCATED  IN A COUNTY HAVING A POPULATION OF NOT LESS THAN SIXTY-FOUR
    7  THOUSAND THREE HUNDRED  AND  NOT  MORE  THAN  SIXTY-FOUR  THOUSAND  FOUR
    8  HUNDRED  AS  DETERMINED BY THE FEDERAL DECENNIAL CENSUS FOR THE YEAR TWO
    9  THOUSAND.
   10    (H) "RESIDENTIAL CONSTRUCTION WORK" MEANS THE CREATION, MODERNIZATION,
   11  REHABILITATION, EXPANSION OR OTHER IMPROVEMENT OF DWELLING UNITS,  OTHER
   12  THAN  DWELLING UNITS IN A HOTEL, IN THE PORTION OF MIXED-USE PROPERTY TO
   13  BE USED FOR RESIDENTIAL PURPOSES.
   14    2. A MUNICIPALITY MAY, BY LOCAL LAW, PROVIDE FOR THE EXEMPTION OF REAL
   15  PROPERTY IN A DESIGNATED BENEFIT AREA FROM TAXATION AS PROVIDED IN  THIS
   16  SECTION. UPON THE ADOPTION OF SUCH A LOCAL LAW, THE COUNTY IN WHICH SUCH
   17  MUNICIPALITY  IS LOCATED MAY, BY LOCAL LAW, AND ANY SCHOOL DISTRICT, ALL
   18  OR PART OF WHICH IS LOCATED IN SUCH MUNICIPALITY,  MAY,  BY  RESOLUTION,
   19  EXEMPT  SUCH  PROPERTY  FROM  ITS TAXATION IN THE SAME MANNER AND TO THE
   20  SAME EXTENT AS SUCH MUNICIPALITY HAS DONE.
   21    3. UPON THE ADOPTION OF SUCH A LOCAL LAW THE COMMERCIAL  USE  PROPERTY
   22  OR MIXED-USE PROPERTY THAT WAS CONVERTED, CREATED, MODERNIZED, REHABILI-
   23  TATED, EXPANDED OR OTHERWISE IMPROVED, SHALL BE EXEMPT FROM TAXATION AND
   24  SPECIAL  AD  VALOREM  LEVIES AS PROVIDED FOR IN SUBDIVISION FOUR OF THIS
   25  SECTION.
   26    4. (A) (I) FOR A PERIOD OF TWELVE YEARS FOLLOWING THE APPROVAL  OF  AN
   27  APPLICATION,  THE  INCREASE IN ASSESSED VALUE OF SUCH PROPERTY ATTRIBUT-
   28  ABLE TO SUCH CONVERSION, CREATION, MODERNIZATION, REHABILITATION, EXPAN-
   29  SION OR OTHER IMPROVEMENT SHALL BE EXEMPT AS  PROVIDED  IN  SUBPARAGRAPH
   30  (II) OF THIS PARAGRAPH. SUCH EXEMPTION SHALL BE COMPUTED WITH RESPECT TO
   31  THE  "EXEMPTION  BASE".  THE EXEMPTION BASE SHALL BE DETERMINED FOR EACH
   32  YEAR IN WHICH THERE IS AN INCREASE IN  ASSESSED  VALUE  SO  ATTRIBUTABLE
   33  FROM THAT OF THE PREVIOUS YEAR'S ASSESSED VALUE.
   34    (II)  THE  FOLLOWING  SHALL  DETERMINE  THE  COMPUTATION  OF  THE  TAX
   35  EXEMPTION:

   36  YEAR OF EXEMPTION   PERCENTAGE OF EXEMPTION
   37     1 THROUGH 8      100% OF EXEMPTION BASE
   38     9                80% OF EXEMPTION BASE
   39     10               60% OF EXEMPTION BASE
   40     11               40% OF EXEMPTION BASE
   41     12               20% OF EXEMPTION BASE

   42    (B) NO SUCH EXEMPTION SHALL BE GRANTED UNLESS:
   43    (I) SUCH CONVERSION, CREATION, MODERNIZATION,  REHABILITATION,  EXPAN-
   44  SION  OR OTHER IMPROVEMENT WAS COMMENCED SUBSEQUENT TO THE DATE ON WHICH
   45  THE MUNICIPALITY'S LOCAL LAW TOOK EFFECT; AND
   46    (II) THE COST OF SUCH CONVERSION  EXCEEDS  THE  SUM  OF  TEN  THOUSAND
   47  DOLLARS OR SUCH GREATER AMOUNT AS MAY BE SPECIFIED BY LOCAL LAW.
   48    (C)  FOR  PURPOSES  OF  THIS  SECTION  THE TERM "CONVERSION, CREATION,
   49  MODERNIZATION, REHABILITATION, EXPANSION OR OTHER IMPROVEMENT" SHALL NOT
   50  INCLUDE ORDINARY MAINTENANCE AND REPAIRS.
   51    (D) NO SUCH EXEMPTION SHALL BE GRANTED CONCURRENT WITH  OR  SUBSEQUENT
   52  TO  ANY  OTHER  REAL PROPERTY TAX EXEMPTION GRANTED TO THE SAME IMPROVE-
   53  MENTS TO REAL PROPERTY, EXCEPT, WHERE DURING THE PERIOD OF SUCH PREVIOUS
   54  EXEMPTION, PAYMENTS IN LIEU OF TAXES OR OTHER PAYMENTS WERE MADE TO  THE

       S. 863                              3

    1  MUNICIPALITY  IN AN AMOUNT THAT WOULD HAVE BEEN EQUAL TO OR GREATER THAN
    2  THE AMOUNT OF REAL PROPERTY TAXES THAT WOULD  HAVE  BEEN  PAID  ON  SUCH
    3  IMPROVEMENTS  HAD  SUCH  PROPERTY  BEEN GRANTED AN EXEMPTION PURSUANT TO
    4  THIS  SECTION.  IN SUCH CASE, AN EXEMPTION SHALL BE GRANTED FOR A NUMBER
    5  OF YEARS EQUAL TO THE TWELVE YEAR EXEMPTION  GRANTED  PURSUANT  TO  THIS
    6  SECTION LESS THE NUMBER OF YEARS THE PROPERTY WOULD HAVE BEEN PREVIOUSLY
    7  EXEMPT FROM REAL PROPERTY TAXES.
    8    5.  SUCH EXEMPTION SHALL BE GRANTED ONLY UPON APPLICATION BY THE OWNER
    9  OF REAL PROPERTY ON A FORM PRESCRIBED BY THE STATE BOARD. SUCH  APPLICA-
   10  TION  SHALL  BE  FILED  WITH  THE ASSESSOR OF THE MUNICIPALITY OR COUNTY
   11  HAVING THE POWER TO ASSESS PROPERTY FOR TAXATION ON OR BEFORE THE APPRO-
   12  PRIATE TAXABLE STATUS DATE OF SUCH MUNICIPALITY OR COUNTY.
   13    6. IF THE ASSESSOR IS SATISFIED THAT THE APPLICANT IS ENTITLED  TO  AN
   14  EXEMPTION PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION, HE OR SHE SHALL APPROVE THE APPLICA-
   15  TION AND SUCH REAL PROPERTY SHALL THEREAFTER BE EXEMPT FROM TAXATION AND
   16  SPECIAL  AD  VALOREM  LEVIES AS PROVIDED IN THIS SECTION COMMENCING WITH
   17  THE ASSESSMENT ROLL PREPARED AFTER THE TAXABLE STATUS DATE  REFERRED  TO
   18  IN  SUBDIVISION  FIVE  OF  THIS  SECTION.    THE  ASSESSED  VALUE OF ANY
   19  EXEMPTION GRANTED PURSUANT TO THIS  SECTION  SHALL  BE  ENTERED  BY  THE
   20  ASSESSOR  ON  THE  ASSESSMENT  ROLL  WITH THE TAXABLE PROPERTY, WITH THE
   21  AMOUNT OF THE EXEMPTION SHOWN IN A SEPARATE COLUMN.
   22    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately, and shall expire  and  be
   23  deemed repealed twelve years after such date.
